headline: AppLovin Sentiment Shifts As Allegations Retracted And AI Focus Builds
summary: CapitalWatch has retracted money laundering allegations against a major AppLovin shareholder, easing a key reputational risk for NasdaqGS:APP. The resolution comes shortly before AppLovin's upcoming earnings report, shifting attention back to its core advertising technology business. Analyst upgrades and fresh focus on the company’s AI powered ad tech and product set are contributing to renewed interest in the stock. For investors watching NasdaqGS:APP, the timing of this retraction...

headline: Stock Index Futures Muted With U.S. Retail Sales Data in Focus
summary: March S&P 500 E-Mini futures (ESH26) are up +0.03%, and March Nasdaq 100 E-Mini futures (NQH26) are up +0.04% this morning, taking a breather after a recent rally as investors await a slew of U.S. economic data, with particular attention on the retail sales report, remarks from Federal Reserve officials, and a new round of corporate earnings reports.

headline: Is It Time To Reassess AppLovin (APP) After Recent Share Price Pullback
summary: If you are wondering whether AppLovin is still good value after its big run in recent years, this article will walk through what the current share price might be baking in. The stock closed at US$460.38 on the latest trading day, with a 0.3% decline over 7 days and sharper pullbacks of 28.9% over 30 days and 25.5% year to date, while the 1 year return is 22.7% and the 3 year return is very large. Recent headlines around AppLovin have focused on its role in mobile app marketing and software...

headline: US Stock Market Today: S&P 500 Futures Edge Higher As Inflation Expectations Cool
summary: The Morning Bull - US Market Morning Update Tuesday, Feb, 10 2026 US stock futures are slightly higher this morning, with E-mini S&P 500 contracts up about 0.05% and Dow futures also edging into positive territory, as investors focus on falling bond yields and cooling inflation expectations. The US 10 year Treasury yield has dipped below 4.2%, which can ease borrowing costs for households and companies. At the same time, one year ahead US inflation expectations have softened to 3.1%, hinting...
